nav.div: Farmington Municipal Schools » COVID-19 Updates and Info » Important messages from local agencies » Messages from the City of Farmington

div.h1: Messages from the City of Farmington

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: 16px;

span.a: Press Releases from the City of Farmington can be found below.

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: 16px;
p.span: The following is a courtesy post from San Juan Regional Medical Center (SJRMC) and the City of Farmington:

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small;
p.span: FARMINGTON, NM (March 19, 2020) – It is critical that everyone know that those without symptoms of COVID-19 infection - those symptoms being fever, cough, body aches, sore throat, runny nose and any other flu/cold-like symptoms– do not need testing for COVID-19.

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small;
p.span: “In order to best serve our community during the COVID-19 national emergency, we are asking the community for their support in helping us serve the most vulnerable by not coming to the testing assessment area unless they are exhibiting symptoms. It is important that we come together to serve everyone. The safety of our caregivers and community is our highest priority.” said Jeff Bourgeois, SJRMC President and CEO.

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small;
p.span: Testing needs to be prioritized for those with symptoms of COVID-19 infection: fever, cough, body aches, sore throat, runny nose and any other flu/cold-like symptoms. Workplaces should not mandate that employees get tested for COVID-19 UNLESS employees are displaying symptoms: fever, cough, or shortness of breath. If a patient comes to the assessment and symptoms are not present, you will not be tested. Testing is at the discretion and judgement of the provider performing the assessment. Please place your trust in us as medical professionals who are working so hard to protect and treat our community and

only come to the assessment if you are currently exhibiting COVID-19 symptoms. It is also critical that those who DO have symptoms of COVID-19 do NOT enter medical facilities without first contacting them, especially emergency departments.Unless you have serious, emergent symptoms, you should not enter emergency departments.

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: 16px;
line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small;
p.span: The next assessment will take place on Friday, March 20.

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: 16px;
line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: 16px;
p.span: Who: Only those patients experiencing flu/cold-like symptoms including fever, cough, or shortness of breath and/or muscle cramping

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: 16px;
p.span: When: Friday, March 20 from 3:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m.

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: 16px;
p.span: Where: Parking Lot K of the SJRMC Campus – located on West Pinon Street next to San Juan Health Partners Midwifery and Women’s Health (See attached map)

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: 16px;
p.span: For the latest updates from San Juan Regional Medical Center on COVID-19, please visit our website at
, follow us on social media or call our coronavirus information hotline at 505.516.0938 or toll free at 888.949.5387.

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: 16px;
line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: 16px;
p.span: Press Releases from the City of Farmington can be found below:

div.style: float: right; position: absolute; display: none

a.span: See Something, Say Something: Report Online

div.p: Farmington Municipal Schools does not discriminate nor tolerate harassment on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, genetic information or pregnancy in its educational programs, services or activities, or in its hiring or employment practices; and it will take immediate action to eliminate such harassment, prevent its recurrence, and address its effects.
Anyone experiencing any form of discrimination or harassment should contact the Executive Director of Human Resources (505-324-9840) to report the incident.
